snippet.textDisplay: Awesome theme from a very awesome game. Still don't understand why this plays in an area on the map titled "Tal Tal Mountain Range" instead of actually playing in Tal Tal Heights, which just plays the overworld theme, though.
snippet.textOriginal: Awesome theme from a very awesome game. Still don't understand why this plays in an area on the map titled "Tal Tal Mountain Range" instead of actually playing in Tal Tal Heights, which just plays the overworld theme, though.

snippet.textDisplay: I mean, I always thought of this as the Mountain song.  It's definitely suited for that area of the game.  It would not fit the actual Tal Tal Heights area.
snippet.textOriginal: I mean, I always thought of this as the Mountain song.  It's definitely suited for that area of the game.  It would not fit the actual Tal Tal Heights area.

snippet.textDisplay: My favorite 2D Zelda game to date. I've always preferred the 2D games to the 3D ones, with the exception of Wind Waker. Given, I have never played Majora's Mask. But there's just some... charm, I guess, about the 2D Zelda games that really makes it for me... It's hard to explain.
snippet.textOriginal: My favorite 2D Zelda game to date. I've always preferred the 2D games to the 3D ones, with the exception of Wind Waker. Given, I have never played Majora's Mask. But there's just some... charm, I guess, about the 2D Zelda games that really makes it for me... It's hard to explain.

snippet.textDisplay:
I was born late enough to miss the NES era, but fortunately I was just in time for the "Game Boy on long car trips" era.

For some reason, the sound got on my family's nerves, and I didn't have headphones, so I had to turn the volume down. But I would always hold the speaker up to my ear just to hear this music. Awesome music, awesome game.
snippet.textOriginal:
I was born late enough to miss the NES era, but fortunately I was just in time for the "Game Boy on long car trips" era.

For some reason, the sound got on my family's nerves, and I didn't have headphones, so I had to turn the volume down. But I would always hold the speaker up to my ear just to hear this music. Awesome music, awesome game.

and ofcours you got some gomba like creatures Link can kill in the same way as mario by jumping on them not to speak of the fish in the waters but then again Shigeru Miyamoto have his legasy with Mario and zelda so it might give some clue about why even a frog loking like Wart from SMB 2 is in Links awakening ;D

snippet.textDisplay: Back in the fourth grade I played this game for the very first time on the Game Boy Color when it was remade/ported along with a friend. Since I knew Zelda games ery well and how they played at the time we would take turns playing with me taking the game home to play and him taking the game home and soemtimes we'd play it in the boys' bathroom or on the bus during a field trip. The dungeons are pretty fun and the shopkeeper that kills you when you stole was hilarious!
snippet.textOriginal: Back in the fourth grade I played this game for the very first time on the Game Boy Color when it was remade/ported along with a friend. Since I knew Zelda games ery well and how they played at the time we would take turns playing with me taking the game home to play and him taking the game home and soemtimes we'd play it in the boys' bathroom or on the bus during a field trip. The dungeons are pretty fun and the shopkeeper that kills you when you stole was hilarious!

snippet.textDisplay: This game and it's soundtrack was amazing, as close as you could get to having a handheld LTTP (not including, y'know, the GBA port of LTTP...) This game is such a large part of my childhood. Thanks Supra, you made an old gamer smile today :)
